Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a large brown pottery vessel, exterior is grooved towards the top and covered with a red/brown slip and with remains of at least sixteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now very worn and faded in places, and containing a contract for work.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.132-33)
Till 1954 / Erbrechtliche Untersuchungen auf Grund der koptischen Urkunden (no.2)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87645) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87645)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 161 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
